wikipedia_page.main: Charles William Christopher Packe (2 May 1909 – 1 July 1944) was an English cricketer who played first-class cricket for Leicestershire between 1929 and 1934 and captained the team for much of the 1932 season. He was born at Pietermaritzburg, South Africa and died near Caen, France during the Second World War. He was a career army officer and also played cricket for the British Army cricket team.
